question: Which country houses "Armorican Massif"?
explanation: The Armorican Massif is a geologic massif that covers a large area in the northwest of France. It is important because it is connected to Dover on the British side of the English Channel and there has been tilting back and forth that has controlled the geography on both sides. The Cantabrian Mountains and the Armorican Massif from the rift shoulders of the Bay of Biscay.
